41/*!
42 \brief Computes bitcount of AND operation of two bitsets
43 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
44 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
45 \return bitcount of the result
46 \ingroup setalgo
47*/
48template<class BV>
49typename BV::size_type count_and(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
50{
51 return bm::distance_and_operation(bv1, bv2);
52}
53
54/*!
55 \brief Computes if there is any bit in AND operation of two bitsets
56 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
57 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
58 \return non zero value if there is any bit
59 \ingroup setalgo
60*/
61template<class BV>
62typename BV::size_type any_and(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
63{
64 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_AND);
65
66 distance_operation_any(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
67 return dmd.result;
68}
69
70
71
72/*!
73 \brief Computes bitcount of XOR operation of two bitsets
74 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
75 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
76 \return bitcount of the result
77 \ingroup setalgo
78*/
79template<class BV>
80bm::distance_metric_descriptor::size_type
81count_xor(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
82{
83 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_XOR);
84
85 distance_operation(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
86 return dmd.result;
87}
88
89/*!
90 \brief Computes if there is any bit in XOR operation of two bitsets
91 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
92 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
93 \return non zero value if there is any bit
94 \ingroup setalgo
95*/
96template<class BV>
97typename BV::size_type any_xor(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
98{
99 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_XOR);
100
101 distance_operation_any(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
102 return dmd.result;
103}

107/*!
108 \brief Computes bitcount of SUB operation of two bitsets
109 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
110 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
111 \return bitcount of the result
112 \ingroup setalgo
113*/
114template<class BV>
115typename BV::size_type count_sub(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
116{
117 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_SUB_AB);
118
119 distance_operation(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
120 return dmd.result;
121}

125 \brief Computes if there is any bit in SUB operation of two bitsets
126 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
127 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
128 \return non zero value if there is any bit
129 \ingroup setalgo
130*/
131template<class BV>
132typename BV::size_type any_sub(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
133{
134 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_SUB_AB);
135
136 distance_operation_any(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);

141/*!
142 \brief Computes bitcount of OR operation of two bitsets
143 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
144 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
145 \return bitcount of the result
146 \ingroup setalgo
147*/
148template<class BV>
149typename BV::size_type count_or(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
150{
151 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_OR);
152
153 distance_operation(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
154 return dmd.result;

157/*!
158 \brief Computes if there is any bit in OR operation of two bitsets
159 \param bv1 - Argument bit-vector.
160 \param bv2 - Argument bit-vector.
161 \return non zero value if there is any bit
162 \ingroup setalgo
163*/
164template<class BV>
165typename BV::size_type any_or(const BV& bv1, const BV& bv2) BMNOEXCEPT
166{
167 distance_metric_descriptor dmd(bm::COUNT_OR);
168
169 distance_operation_any(bv1, bv2, &dmd, &dmd + 1);
170 return dmd.result;

173
174
175#define BM_SCANNER_OP(x) \
176if (0 != (block = blk_blk[j+x])) \
177{ int ret;\
178 if (BM_IS_GAP(block)) \
179 { \
180 ret = bm::for_each_gap_blk(BMGAP_PTR(block), (r+j+x)*bm::bits_in_block,\
181 bit_functor); \
182 } \
183 else \
184 { \
185 ret = bm::for_each_bit_blk(block, (r+j+x)*bm::bits_in_block,bit_functor); \
186 } \
187 if (ret < 0) return ret; \
188}
189
190
191/**
192 @brief bit-vector visitor scanner to traverse each 1 bit using C++ visitor
193
194 @param bv - bit vector to scan
195 @param bit_functor - visitor: should support add_bits(), add_range()
196 @return return code from functor (< 0 indicates to interrupt iteration and exit)
197
198 \ingroup setalgo
199 @sa for_each_bit_range visit_each_bit
200*/
201template<class BV, class Func>
202int for_each_bit(const BV& bv,
203 Func& bit_functor)
204{
205 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
206
207 const typename BV::blocks_manager_type& bman = bv.get_blocks_manager();
208 bm::word_t*** blk_root = bman.top_blocks_root();
209
210 if (!blk_root)
211 return 0;
212
213 unsigned tsize = bman.top_block_size();
214 for (unsigned i = 0; i < tsize; ++i)
215 {
216 bm::word_t** blk_blk = blk_root[i];
217 if (!blk_blk)
218 continue;
219
220 if ((bm::word_t*)blk_blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
221 blk_blk = FULL_SUB_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
222
223 const bm::word_t* block;
224 size_type r = size_type(i) * bm::set_sub_array_size;
225 unsigned j = 0;
226 do
227 {
228 #ifdef BM64_AVX2
229 if (!avx2_test_all_zero_wave(blk_blk + j))
230 {
231 BM_SCANNER_OP(0)
232 BM_SCANNER_OP(1)
233 BM_SCANNER_OP(2)
234 BM_SCANNER_OP(3)
235 }
236 j += 4;
237 #elif defined(BM64_SSE4)
238 if (!sse42_test_all_zero_wave(blk_blk + j))
239 {
240 BM_SCANNER_OP(0)
241 BM_SCANNER_OP(1)
242 }
243 j += 2;
244 #else
245 BM_SCANNER_OP(0)
246 ++j;
247 #endif
248
249 } while (j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
250 } // for i
251 return 0;
252}
253
254/**
255 @brief bit-vector range visitor to traverse each 1 bit
256
257 @param bv - bit vector to scan
258 @param right - start of closed interval [from..to]
259 @param left - end of close interval [from..to]
260 @param bit_functor - visitor: should support add_bits(), add_range()
261
262 \ingroup setalgo
263 @sa for_each_bit
264*/
265template<class BV, class Func>
266int for_each_bit_range(const BV& bv,
267 typename BV::size_type left,
268 typename BV::size_type right,
269 Func& bit_functor)
270{
271 if (left > right)
272 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
273 if (right == bm::id_max)
274 --right;
275 BM_ASSERT(left < bm::id_max && right < bm::id_max);
276 int res = bm::for_each_bit_range_no_check(bv, left, right, bit_functor);
277 return res;
278}
279
280
281#undef BM_SCANNER_OP
282
283
284/// functor-adaptor for C-style callbacks
285///
286/// @internal
287///
288template <class VCBT, class size_type>
289struct bit_visitor_callback_adaptor
290{
291 typedef VCBT bit_visitor_callback_type;
292
293 bit_visitor_callback_adaptor(void* h, bit_visitor_callback_type cb_func)
294 : handle_(h), func_(cb_func)
295 {}
296
297 int add_bits(size_type offset, const unsigned char* bits, unsigned size)
298 {
299 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size; ++i)
300 {
301 int ret = func_(handle_, offset + bits[i]);
302 if (ret < 0)
303 return ret;
304 }
305 return 0;
306 }
307 int add_range(size_type offset, size_type size)
308 {
309 for (size_type i = 0; i < size; ++i)
310 {
311 int ret = func_(handle_, offset + i);
312 if (ret < 0)
313 return ret;
314 }
315 return 0;
316 }
317
318 void* handle_;
319 bit_visitor_callback_type func_;
320};
321
322
323/// Functor for bit-copy (for testing)
324///
325/// @internal
326///
327template <class BV>
328struct bit_vistor_copy_functor
329{
330 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
331
332 bit_vistor_copy_functor(BV& bv)
333 : bv_(bv)
334 {
335 bv_.init();
336 }
337
338 int add_bits(size_type offset, const unsigned char* bits, unsigned size)
339 {
340 BM_ASSERT(size);
341 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size; ++i)
342 bv_.set_bit_no_check(offset + bits[i]);
343 return 0;
344 }
345 int add_range(size_type offset, size_type size)
346 {
347 BM_ASSERT(size);
348 bv_.set_range(offset, offset + size - 1);
349 return 0;
350 }
351
352 BV& bv_;
353 bit_visitor_callback_type func_;
354};
355
356
357
358/**
359 @brief bvector visitor scanner to traverse each 1 bit using C callback
360
361 @param bv - bit vector to scan
362 @param handle_ptr - handle to private memory used by callback
363 @param callback_ptr - callback function
364
365 @return exit code form call back function
366
367 \ingroup setalgo
368
369 @sa bit_visitor_callback_type
370*/
371template<class BV>
372int visit_each_bit(const BV& bv,
373 void* handle_ptr,
374 bit_visitor_callback_type callback_ptr)
375{
376 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
377 bm::bit_visitor_callback_adaptor<bit_visitor_callback_type, size_type>
378 func(handle_ptr, callback_ptr);
379 int res = bm::for_each_bit(bv, func);
380 return res;
381}
382
383/**
384 @brief bvector visitor scanner to traverse each bits in range (C callback)
385
386 @param bv - bit vector to scan
387 @param left - from [left..right]
388 @param right - to [left..right]
389 @param handle_ptr - handle to private memory used by callback
390 @param callback_ptr - callback function
391 @return exit code form call back function
392
393 \ingroup setalgo
394
395 @sa bit_visitor_callback_type for_each_bit
396*/
397template<class BV>
398int visit_each_bit_range(const BV& bv,
399 typename BV::size_type left,
400 typename BV::size_type right,
401 void* handle_ptr,
402 bit_visitor_callback_type callback_ptr)
403{
404 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
405 bm::bit_visitor_callback_adaptor<bit_visitor_callback_type, size_type>
406 func(handle_ptr, callback_ptr);
407 int res = bm::for_each_bit_range(bv, left, right, func);
408 return res;
409}
410
411/**
412 @brief Algorithm to identify bit-vector ranges (splits) for the rank
413
414 Rank range split algorithm walks the bit-vector to create list of
415 non-overlapping ranges [s1..e1],[s2..e2]...[sN...eN] with requested
416 (rank) number of 1 bits. All ranges should be the same popcount weight,
417 except the last one, which may have less.
418 Scan is progressing from left to right so result ranges will be
419 naturally sorted.
420
421 @param bv - bit vector to perform the range split scan
422 @param rank - requested number of bits in each range
423 if 0 it will create single range [first..last]
424 to cover the whole bv
425 @param target_v - [out] STL(or STL-like) vector of pairs to keep pairs results
426
427 \ingroup setalgo
428 */
429template<typename BV, typename PairVect>
430void rank_range_split(const BV& bv,
431 typename BV::size_type rank,
432 PairVect& target_v)
433{
434 target_v.resize(0);
435 typename BV::size_type first, last, pos;
436 bool found = bv.find_range(first, last);
437 if (!found) // empty bit-vector
438 return;
439
440 if (!rank) // if rank is not defined, include the whole vector [first..last]
441 {
442 typename PairVect::value_type pv;
443 pv.first = first; pv.second = last;
444 target_v.push_back(pv);
445 return;
446 }
447
448 while (1)
449 {
450 typename PairVect::value_type pv;
451 found = bv.find_rank(rank, first, pos);
452 if (found)
453 {
454 pv.first = first; pv.second = pos;
455 target_v.push_back(pv);
456 if (pos >= last)
457 break;
458 first = pos + 1;
459 continue;
460 }
461 // insufficient rank (last range)
462 found = bv.any_range(first, last);
463 if (found)
464 {
465 pv.first = first; pv.second = last;
466 target_v.push_back(pv);
467 }
468 break;
469 } // while
470
471}
472
473
474
475/**
476 Algorithms for rank compression of bit-vector
477
478 1. Source vector (bv_src) is a subset of index vector (bv_idx)
479 2. As a subset it can be collapsed using bit-rank method, where each position
480 in the source vector is defined by population count (range)
481 [0..index_position] (count_range())
482 As a result all integer set of source vector gets re-mapped in
483 accord with the index vector.
484
485 \ingroup setalgo
486*/
487template<typename BV>
488class rank_compressor
489{
490public:
491 typedef BV bvector_type;
492 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
493 typedef typename BV::rs_index_type rs_index_type;
494 enum buffer_cap
495 {
496 n_buffer_cap = 1024
497 };
498public:
499
500 /**
501 Rank decompression
502 */
503 void decompress(BV& bv_target, const BV& bv_idx, const BV& bv_src);
504
505 /**
506 Rank compression algorithm based on two palallel iterators/enumerators
507 set of source vector gets re-mapped in accord with the index/rank vector.
508
509 \param bv_target - target bit-vector
510 \param bv_idx - index (rank) vector used for address recalculation
511 \param bv_src - source vector for re-mapping
512 */
513 void compress(BV& bv_target, const BV& bv_idx, const BV& bv_src);
514
515 /**
516 \brief Source vector priority + index based rank
517
518 @sa compress
519 */
520 void compress_by_source(BV& bv_target,
521 const BV& bv_idx,
522 const rs_index_type& bc_idx,
523 const BV& bv_src);
524};
525
526
527// ------------------------------------------------------------------------
528//
529// ------------------------------------------------------------------------
530
531
532template<class BV>
533void rank_compressor<BV>::compress(BV& bv_target,
534 const BV& bv_idx,
535 const BV& bv_src)
536{
537 bv_target.clear();
538 bv_target.init();
539
540 if (&bv_idx == &bv_src)
541 {
542 bv_target = bv_src;
543 return;
544 }
545 size_type ibuffer[n_buffer_cap];
546 size_type b_size;
547
548 typedef typename BV::enumerator enumerator_t;
549 enumerator_t en_s = bv_src.first();
550 enumerator_t en_i = bv_idx.first();
551
552 size_type r_idx = b_size = 0;
553 size_type i, s;
554
555 for (; en_i.valid(); )
556 {
557 if (!en_s.valid())
558 break;
559 i = *en_i; s = *en_s;
560
561 BM_ASSERT(s >= i);
562 BM_ASSERT(bv_idx.test(i));
563
564 if (i == s)
565 {
566 ibuffer[b_size++] = r_idx++;
567 if (b_size == n_buffer_cap)
568 {
569 bv_target.set(ibuffer, b_size, bm::BM_SORTED);
570 b_size = 0;
571 }
572 ++en_i; ++en_s;
573 continue;
574 }
575 BM_ASSERT(s > i);
576
577 size_type dist = s - i;
578 if (dist >= 64) // sufficiently far away, jump
579 {
580 size_type r_dist = bv_idx.count_range(i + 1, s);
581 r_idx += r_dist;
582 en_i.go_to(s);
583 BM_ASSERT(en_i.valid());
584 }
585 else // small distance, iterate to close the gap
586 {
587 for (; s > i; ++r_idx)
588 {
589 ++en_i;
590 i = *en_i;
591 } // for
592 BM_ASSERT(en_i.valid());
593 }
594 } // for
595
596 if (b_size)
597 {
598 bv_target.set(ibuffer, b_size, bm::BM_SORTED);
599 }
600
601}
602
603// ------------------------------------------------------------------------
604
605template<class BV>
606void rank_compressor<BV>::decompress(BV& bv_target,
607 const BV& bv_idx,
608 const BV& bv_src)
609{
610 bv_target.clear();
611 bv_target.init();
612
613 if (&bv_idx == &bv_src)
614 {
615 bv_target = bv_src;
616 return;
617 }
618
619 size_type r_idx, i, s, b_size;
620 size_type ibuffer[n_buffer_cap];
621
622 b_size = r_idx = 0;
623
624 typedef typename BV::enumerator enumerator_t;
625 enumerator_t en_s = bv_src.first();
626 enumerator_t en_i = bv_idx.first();
627 for (; en_i.valid(); )
628 {
629 if (!en_s.valid())
630 break;
631 s = *en_s;
632 i = *en_i;
633 if (s == r_idx)
634 {
635 ibuffer[b_size++] = i;
636 if (b_size == n_buffer_cap)
637 {
638 bv_target.set(ibuffer, b_size, bm::BM_SORTED);
639 b_size = 0;
640 }
641 ++en_i; ++en_s; ++r_idx;
642 continue;
643 }
644 // source is "faster" than index, need to re-align
645 BM_ASSERT(s > r_idx);
646 size_type rank = s - r_idx + 1u;
647 size_type new_pos = 0;
648
649 if (rank < 256)
650 {
651 en_i.skip(s - r_idx);
652 BM_ASSERT(en_i.valid());
653 new_pos = *en_i;
654 }
655 else
656 {
657 bv_idx.find_rank(rank, i, new_pos);
658 BM_ASSERT(new_pos);
659 en_i.go_to(new_pos);
660 BM_ASSERT(en_i.valid());
661 }
662
663 r_idx = s;
664 ibuffer[b_size++] = new_pos;
665 if (b_size == n_buffer_cap)
666 {
667 bv_target.set(ibuffer, b_size, bm::BM_SORTED);
668 b_size = 0;
669 }
670 ++en_i; ++en_s; ++r_idx;
671
672 } // for en
673
674 if (b_size)
675 {
676 bv_target.set(ibuffer, b_size, bm::BM_SORTED);
677 }
678}
679
680// ------------------------------------------------------------------------
681
682template<class BV>
683void rank_compressor<BV>::compress_by_source(BV& bv_target,
684 const BV& bv_idx,
685 const rs_index_type& bc_idx,
686 const BV& bv_src)
687{
688 /// Rank compressor visitor (functor)
689 /// @internal
690 struct visitor_func
691 {
692 visitor_func(bvector_type& bv_out,
693 const bvector_type& bv_index,
694 const rs_index_type& bc_index)
695 : bv_target_(bv_out),
696 bv_index_(bv_index),
697 bc_index_(bc_index)
698 {}
699
700 int add_bits(size_type arr_offset, const unsigned char* bits, unsigned bits_size)
701 {
702 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bits_size; ++i)
703 {
704 size_type idx = arr_offset + bits[i];
705 BM_ASSERT(bv_index_.test(idx));
706
707 size_type r_idx = bv_index_.count_to(idx, bc_index_) - 1;
708 bv_target_.set_bit_no_check(r_idx);
709 }
710 return 0;
711 }
712 int add_range(size_type arr_offset, size_type sz)
713 {
714 for (size_type i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
715 {
716 size_type idx = i + arr_offset;
717 BM_ASSERT(bv_index_.test(idx));
718
719 size_type r_idx = bv_index_.count_to(idx, bc_index_) - 1;
720 bv_target_.set_bit_no_check(r_idx);
721 }
722 return 0;
723 }
724
725 bvector_type& bv_target_;
726 const bvector_type& bv_index_;
727 const rs_index_type& bc_index_;
728 };
729 // ------------------------------------
730
731 bv_target.clear();
732 bv_target.init();
733
734 if (&bv_idx == &bv_src)
735 {
736 bv_target = bv_src;
737 return;
738 }
739 visitor_func func(bv_target, bv_idx, bc_idx);
740 bm::for_each_bit(bv_src, func);
741}
742
743
744
745
746} // bm
